title: Creating A JavaFX User Interface
summary: A JavaFX user interface is created from a number of elements. These elements are organized into a Scene, which is the root of all JavaFX interfaces. The VBox is used as the root node of the Scene, so it has no positioning. The layout defines how the controls inside the VBox will be positioned, and how large each control will be. The next step is to select a control to be used in our JavaFX User Interface. We also learned about the advantages of using third-party libraries.
